EducationDetails.Text:
Prime Digital Academy
Received Certificate of User Experience Design, February 2020

• South Central College graphic communications program advisory board member.
January 2010 -- April 2019

Minnesota State University, Mankato
Received BFA, March 1997
• Specialization: Graphic Design

• Secondary Specialization: Photography
• Graduated Magna Cum Laude
• Received Taylor Corporation Scholarship
• Received AIGA Scholarship

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Marketing (Digital; Advertising; Marketing Communications).    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~   has 24 years of work experience.

Positions.Description:
• Created GenEQTY neobank native app strategy and prototype.
• Created Skyway Helper augmented reality (AR) wayfinding native app concept and prototypes.
• Created static and interactive prototypes of apps, websites and multi-touchpoint experiences
at various levels of fidelity. Conducted various styles of user research. Conducted user testing in situational and lab environments.

March 1997 through April 2019
I was employed by and then partner of a design agency, photo studio and publishing business. While with the firm I filled many roles, including:
• Senior Graphic Designer: Managed projects with agency clients. Created logos, rebrands, icons, brochures,
marketing collateral, catalogs, books, illustrations, web sites, signage, print and digital advertisements,
web and social media graphics, etc. Coordinated art production with interns, junior designers, illustrators,
writers, photographers and web developers.
• Web Designer/Developer: Planned, conceived, designed and deployed conventional and mobile
responsive websites for internal and external clients. Deployed, maintained and secured Wordpress
websites. Worked with external developers to create custom website functionality.
• Art Director and Staff Photographer of Connect Business Magazine: Managed overall magazine design
and appearance. Supervised and created editorial layouts. Developed and designed display advertising.
Photography, photo direction and photo retouching responsibilities. Managed magazine social media
presence. Managed magazine content strategy with editorial team. Conceived, developed and designed
sponsored content advertising offering. Developed digital advertising platform. Design, implementation and maintenance of magazine website.
• Photographer: Created product, portrait and editorial photography. Developed product photography
business as a stand-alone company offering.
• Partner: Managed overall firm business strategy. Managed employees, contractors and freelancers.
Managed print vendors. Created company marketing campaigns including digital, social media and print
advertising.

Created posters, logos, brochures, websites, signage, etc for campus events,
organizations and facilities.

Certifications.Name: Received Certificate of User Experience Design

Associations.Organization: South Central College graphic communications program advisory

QualificationsSummary:
SKILLS
• UX Research: AEIOU observation, affinity diagraming, behavioral mapping (shadowed), cognitive
walkthrough, contextual inquiry, generative research, heuristic analysis, interviewing, kano analysis,
personas, photo studies, storyboards, user journey maps, usability testing, wizard of oz.
• UX/UI Prototyping: Hand sketches, feature cards, InVision, Axure, Protopie, Sketch, Adobe XD,
HTML/CSS prototyping; AR/augmented reality prototyping, Apple Reality Composer.
• Visual Design: Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Aero, Acrobat); journey map
visual design and layout; 3D modeling and rendering (Blender); 2D illustration; photo retouching.
• Development: Hosting and domain management; SEO; Wordpress website implementation, design
customization, maintenance and security; HTML and CSS coding and editing.
• Print Design: Print graphic design expertise; prepress file prep; press checks.

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
The resume contains a contact information section that is not the first section. A resume should always include the candidate's contact info at the top of the resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.

and appearance. Supervised and created editorial layouts. Developed and designed display advertising.
